page.title: 13LANDSCAPE 3
page.content: There are eight small brick{bridges across the stream at{Marshside,}they give access to the fields of the Chislet Marshes. They are of different shapes and sizes, one has a pointed arch and another is elliptical,the rest are round. Two of the eight bridges have stone arches and parapet tops but the rest are wholly of brick. One of the stone bridges is dated{1793 on the keystone. This date is thought to be that of the construction of these bridges, although they must be the latest in a long line of bridges that have served the community. The waterway crossed by the bridges is the {North Stream.}It forms the western boundary of the marsh and is most important for the drainage of the high ground. The bridges that cross it are essential to both public and farmers.
